intro: Saracha coronopus, commonly known as the crownwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features a slender, branching stem with small, green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, giving it a delicate appearance. Saracha coronopus is typically found in rocky or coastal areas and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
